data:
1
00:00:18,143 --> 00:00:20,437
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:22,022 --> 00:00:24,900
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:24,900 --> 00:00:27,611
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:28,779 --> 00:00:31,490
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:31,490 --> 00:00:36,703
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:36,703 --> 00:00:39,331
They called this ability
''Tuning.''

7
00:00:40,582 --> 00:00:42,459
But they were dying.

8
00:00:42,459 --> 00:00:45,587
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:45,587 --> 00:00:48,257
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:48,257 --> 00:00:50,884
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:52,344 --> 00:00:55,889
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:55,889 --> 00:00:57,975
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:59,017 --> 00:01:00,477
Our world.

14
00:01:01,520 --> 00:01:03,605
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:03,605 --> 00:01:05,482
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:16,326 --> 00:01:19,246
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:20,205 --> 00:01:21,832
l am just a man.

18
00:01:21,832 --> 00:01:25,210
l help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:26,253 --> 00:01:28,338
l have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:55,796 --> 00:04:57,589
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:57,589 --> 00:05:00,509
Frightened. That's all right.
l can help you.

22
00:05:00,509 --> 00:05:02,094
-Who is this?
-l'm a doctor.

23
00:05:02,094 --> 00:05:04,888
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:04,888 --> 00:05:07,099
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:07,099 --> 00:05:09,268
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:09,268 --> 00:05:11,353
No, l don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:11,353 --> 00:05:14,147
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:14,147 --> 00:05:16,483
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:17,609 --> 00:05:19,778
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:06:02,029 --> 00:06:04,531
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:04,531 --> 00:06:05,991
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:07,034 --> 00:06:10,704
l suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:10,704 --> 00:06:12,456
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:14,541 --> 00:06:16,084
l've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:16,084 --> 00:06:19,213
lt's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:19,213 --> 00:06:21,757
Day and date.

37
00:06:21,757 --> 00:06:25,052
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:25,052 --> 00:06:28,096
-l'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:28,096 --> 00:06:30,265
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:30,265 --> 00:06:31,642
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:49,576 --> 00:06:52,287
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:52,287 --> 00:06:54,790
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:05,717 --> 00:07:09,513
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:09,513 --> 00:07:12,933
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:14,268 --> 00:07:15,936
Sleep now.

46
00:07:18,689 --> 00:07:22,734
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:22,734 --> 00:07:24,945
Dance with me

48
00:07:24,945 --> 00:07:28,073
Make me sway

49
00:07:28,073 --> 00:07:32,035
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:32,035 --> 00:07:34,288
Hold me close

51
00:07:34,288 --> 00:07:37,124
Sway me more

52
00:07:37,124 --> 00:07:41,295
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:41,503 --> 00:07:43,922
Bend with me

54
00:07:43,922 --> 00:07:46,800
Sway with ease

55
00:07:46,800 --> 00:07:50,762
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:50,762 --> 00:07:53,307
Stay with me

57
00:07:53,307 --> 00:07:55,893
Sway with me

58
00:07:56,602 --> 00:08:00,772
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:08:00,772 --> 00:08:02,274
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:22,461 --> 00:08:23,754
Excuse me.

61
00:08:25,714 --> 00:08:27,382
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:27,382 --> 00:08:31,553
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:32,679 --> 00:08:36,141
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:36,141 --> 00:08:37,601
What is this?

65
00:08:37,601 --> 00:08:41,271
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:41,271 --> 00:08:45,025
l don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:45,025 --> 00:08:47,611
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:47,611 --> 00:08:50,447
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:50,447 --> 00:08:51,865
for quite some time.

70
00:08:51,865 --> 00:08:55,327
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:55,327 --> 00:08:58,455
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:58,455 --> 00:09:00,332
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:09:01,708 --> 00:09:03,961
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:03,961 --> 00:09:06,880
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:06,880 --> 00:09:09,508
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:09,508 --> 00:09:12,302
l understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:12,302 --> 00:09:13,804
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:13,804 --> 00:09:16,723
l would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:16,723 --> 00:09:20,435
lt appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:20,435 --> 00:09:23,564
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:23,564 --> 00:09:26,608
Oh, but l am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:26,608 --> 00:09:27,860
Even violent.

83
00:09:29,236 --> 00:09:33,198
lf he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:33,198 --> 00:09:36,118
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:37,452 --> 00:09:38,579
For himself.

86
00:09:48,797 --> 00:09:52,968
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
lt is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:53,635 --> 00:09:57,055
Mr. ''J'' something Murdoch?

88
00:10:00,517 --> 00:10:05,063
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:08,942 --> 00:10:11,111
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:11,111 --> 00:10:14,072
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:19,995 --> 00:10:21,788
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:45,854 --> 00:10:49,316
l told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:49,316 --> 00:10:52,653
l said, ''Listen,
three weeks is three weeks.''

94
00:10:52,653 --> 00:10:56,615
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:57,449 --> 00:10:58,784
The call girl.

96
00:11:03,497 --> 00:11:06,375
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-lnspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:06,375 --> 00:11:08,043
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:09,419 --> 00:11:10,546
Sorry.

99
00:11:19,012 --> 00:11:20,681
Am l glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:20,681 --> 00:11:23,308
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:23,308 --> 00:11:25,894
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:56,466 --> 00:11:58,927
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:12:01,430 --> 00:12:03,098
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:03,974 --> 00:12:06,685
-You left your wallet here.
-When did l do that?

105
00:12:06,685 --> 00:12:08,854
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:08,854 --> 00:12:12,733
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:18,155 --> 00:12:20,824
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:38,258 --> 00:12:40,135
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:40,135 --> 00:12:41,512
And where's home?

110
00:12:41,512 --> 00:12:44,306
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:44,306 --> 00:12:46,600
l'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:46,600 --> 00:12:48,685
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:48,685 --> 00:12:51,730
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:54,650 --> 00:12:56,401
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:05,369 --> 00:13:06,411
Come on.

116
00:13:09,623 --> 00:13:12,459
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:12,459 --> 00:13:15,796
-l believe so, sir.
-Give the man an ''A'' for effort.

118
00:13:20,801 --> 00:13:23,095
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:23,095 --> 00:13:29,643
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:29,643 --> 00:13:31,562
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:31,562 --> 00:13:34,857
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:34,857 --> 00:13:36,024
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:36,024 --> 00:13:37,901
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:37,901 --> 00:13:40,904
l've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:40,904 --> 00:13:43,198
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:43,198 --> 00:13:45,200
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:45,200 --> 00:13:46,952
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:46,952 --> 00:13:49,037
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:49,788 --> 00:13:50,956
Frank!

130
00:13:53,959 --> 00:13:56,044
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:56,044 --> 00:13:58,338
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:59,798 --> 00:14:01,466
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:04,928 --> 00:14:07,222
Let me go!
l'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:08,765 --> 00:14:10,976
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:19,401 --> 00:14:22,529
l'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:22,529 --> 00:14:26,700
What did l ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:26,909 --> 00:14:29,828
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:29,828 --> 00:14:31,288
should be here, so--

139
00:14:31,288 --> 00:14:34,333
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:36,293 --> 00:14:38,170
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:44,635 --> 00:14:48,055
l came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:48,055 --> 00:14:51,934
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:53,727 --> 00:14:55,354
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:58,482 --> 00:15:01,860
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:02,653 --> 00:15:04,655
Who are these women?

146
00:15:04,655 --> 00:15:06,532
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:06,532 --> 00:15:08,825
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:08,825 --> 00:15:12,371
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:13,831 --> 00:15:17,084
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:18,544 --> 00:15:21,839
Mrs. Murdoch, l am sorry.
l didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:21,839 --> 00:15:24,591
l'm sorry that l came.
l just made a mistake.

152
00:15:24,591 --> 00:15:28,720
lf you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:37,813 --> 00:15:38,939
We met before?

154
00:15:40,732 --> 00:15:43,777
lf we did,
l hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:43,777 --> 00:15:45,320
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:49,157 --> 00:15:50,951
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:58,876 --> 00:16:00,127
l was just thinking.

158
00:16:04,381 --> 00:16:05,841
What you do...

159
00:16:07,134 --> 00:16:12,222
lt seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:12,222 --> 00:16:14,224
How do you know
l'm not the killer?

161
00:16:14,224 --> 00:16:17,853
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:18,395 --> 00:16:20,981
You feeling any urges
l should know about?

163
00:16:32,784 --> 00:16:33,827
Shoot.

164
00:17:21,583 --> 00:17:25,420
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:25,420 --> 00:17:29,591
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:17:30,217 --> 00:17:32,386
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:58,078 --> 00:17:59,204
He can Tune!

168
00:18:52,382 --> 00:18:55,594
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:55,594 --> 00:18:58,722
-lt is said he is able to Tune.
-lmpossible!

170
00:18:58,722 --> 00:19:01,850
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:19:01,850 --> 00:19:04,770
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:04,770 --> 00:19:07,314
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:07,314 --> 00:19:11,026
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:11,026 --> 00:19:13,278
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:13,278 --> 00:19:16,990
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:16,990 --> 00:19:20,118
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:20,118 --> 00:19:22,746
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:26,166 --> 00:19:28,877
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:28,877 --> 00:19:31,797
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:32,756 --> 00:19:34,842
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:35,884 --> 00:19:38,804
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:38,804 --> 00:19:41,807
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:41,807 --> 00:19:44,017
We must have this man.

184
00:19:49,940 --> 00:19:51,108
My brand, l hope.

185
00:20:03,495 --> 00:20:05,038
l've been worried about you.

186
00:20:09,001 --> 00:20:10,377
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:11,086 --> 00:20:13,839
lf disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:13,839 --> 00:20:15,048
l don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:15,048 --> 00:20:16,216
What are you talking about?

190
00:20:19,761 --> 00:20:23,932
l found these keys in my pocket,
so l assume l live here.

191
00:20:25,726 --> 00:20:28,395
-You supposed to be my wife?
-''Supposed to be''?

192
00:20:31,523 --> 00:20:36,028
You really...don't know
who l am, do you.

193
00:20:36,445 --> 00:20:39,281
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:39,281 --> 00:20:40,616
My doctor?

195
00:20:43,535 --> 00:20:47,581
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:55,005 --> 00:20:56,965
Feel like l'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:56,965 --> 00:21:00,427
What happened to me?
Why was l seeing a doctor?

198
00:21:00,427 --> 00:21:01,887
l had an affair.

199
00:21:03,764 --> 00:21:05,265
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:08,352 --> 00:21:11,980
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:21,698 --> 00:21:24,076
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:24,076 --> 00:21:26,829
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:27,329 --> 00:21:31,917
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:32,417 --> 00:21:35,754
-l'm sorry. l--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:35,754 --> 00:21:38,674
l was frightened.
l have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:38,674 --> 00:21:42,261
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:42,261 --> 00:21:44,972
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:44,972 --> 00:21:48,600
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:48,600 --> 00:21:50,686
l tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:50,686 --> 00:21:52,980
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:52,980 --> 00:21:56,233
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:56,233 --> 00:21:57,776
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:57,776 --> 00:22:00,779
l guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:22:01,196 --> 00:22:02,990
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:02,990 --> 00:22:06,869
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:06,869 --> 00:22:09,955
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:09,955 --> 00:22:12,249
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:12,249 --> 00:22:14,459
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:14,459 --> 00:22:15,919
Of course.
l'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:17,588 --> 00:22:20,841
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:20,841 --> 00:22:23,760
lt's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:23,760 --> 00:22:25,512
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:25,512 --> 00:22:28,515
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:28,515 --> 00:22:33,729
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:35,230 --> 00:22:36,857
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:36,857 --> 00:22:39,067
l know. l saw the papers.

227
00:22:39,067 --> 00:22:41,570
''Killer stalks
city street-walkers.''

228
00:22:45,240 --> 00:22:47,534
l was with one of those women.

229
00:22:49,077 --> 00:22:52,539
-Before l came here tonight.
-l don't understand.

230
00:22:52,539 --> 00:22:57,836
l met her outside an Automat.
l guess l wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:59,171 --> 00:23:02,633
l wanted to know if l had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:02,633 --> 00:23:04,092
Maybe l have lost my mind,

233
00:23:04,092 --> 00:23:07,554
but whoever l am, l'm still me,
and l'm not a killer.

234
00:23:13,143 --> 00:23:14,394
l believe you.

235
00:23:16,396 --> 00:23:17,523
You do?

236
00:23:22,152 --> 00:23:24,112
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:24,112 --> 00:23:25,656
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:25,656 --> 00:23:27,991
lt's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:30,077 --> 00:23:31,829
l didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:35,457 --> 00:23:36,917
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:39,336 --> 00:23:42,381
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:42,381 --> 00:23:43,924
l didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:43,924 --> 00:23:46,218
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:46,218 --> 00:23:49,471
Turn yourself in. l'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:49,471 --> 00:23:51,557
You won't believe
what l have to say.

246
00:23:52,683 --> 00:23:56,019
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:56,019 --> 00:23:59,690
lt's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:59,690 --> 00:24:02,609
And l don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:02,609 --> 00:24:04,903
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:04,903 --> 00:24:07,281
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:11,660 --> 00:24:13,620
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:19,918 --> 00:24:20,961
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:03,921 --> 00:25:06,632
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:09,760 --> 00:25:12,137
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:12,137 --> 00:25:15,265
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:15,265 --> 00:25:18,185
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:20,771 --> 00:25:24,024
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:24,024 --> 00:25:27,152
l can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:27,152 --> 00:25:28,487
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:33,200 --> 00:25:36,245
l'm sorry, lnspector,
l cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:36,245 --> 00:25:38,330
but l am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:38,330 --> 00:25:40,415
Well, l appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:49,132 --> 00:25:51,552
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:51,552 --> 00:25:56,139
l've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:56,139 --> 00:25:58,976
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:58,976 --> 00:26:02,187
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:26:02,187 --> 00:26:05,107
Well, l do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:05,107 --> 00:26:09,278
lnspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:09,278 --> 00:26:11,363
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:11,363 --> 00:26:15,325
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:15,325 --> 00:26:18,453
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:18,453 --> 00:26:20,831
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:20,831 --> 00:26:24,418
l would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:24,418 --> 00:26:27,337
Good evening, lnspector.
l really must be going.

275
00:27:04,625 --> 00:27:05,792
Come in.

276
00:27:10,797 --> 00:27:12,549
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:13,800 --> 00:27:16,512
Walenski? lt's me, Frank.

278
00:27:22,893 --> 00:27:24,061
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:27,397 --> 00:27:28,524
Close the door.

280
00:27:36,657 --> 00:27:39,993
l've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:39,993 --> 00:27:42,079
lt's an interesting case.

282
00:27:43,121 --> 00:27:46,333
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:48,001 --> 00:27:51,797
-Or break it.
-Yeah. l was on that case.

284
00:27:51,797 --> 00:27:55,592
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:55,592 --> 00:27:57,094
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:58,053 --> 00:28:00,138
l've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:28:00,138 --> 00:28:02,099
riding in circles.

288
00:28:02,099 --> 00:28:06,061
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:07,938 --> 00:28:09,606
l've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:14,111 --> 00:28:15,946
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:15,946 --> 00:28:17,447
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:19,324 --> 00:28:22,327
l don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:22,327 --> 00:28:26,081
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:27,749 --> 00:28:29,251
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:30,210 --> 00:28:33,046
See, l've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:33,046 --> 00:28:36,175
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:36,175 --> 00:28:38,343
But the more
l try to think back,

298
00:28:38,343 --> 00:28:41,388
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:41,388 --> 00:28:42,681
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:42,681 --> 00:28:46,852
lt's like l've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:46,852 --> 00:28:49,855
and when l finally wake up,
l'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:49,855 --> 00:28:51,857
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:56,195 --> 00:28:58,280
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:59,531 --> 00:29:02,075
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:02,576 --> 00:29:06,038
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:06,038 --> 00:29:10,000
lt's all just a big joke!
lt's a joke!

307
00:29:51,083 --> 00:29:52,835
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:52,835 --> 00:29:56,088
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:56,088 --> 00:29:58,549
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:58,549 --> 00:30:00,759
17 love letters,

311
00:30:00,759 --> 00:30:03,178
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:03,178 --> 00:30:07,349
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:07,432 --> 00:30:09,601
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:12,020 --> 00:30:14,314
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:15,148 --> 00:30:16,316
What is it?

316
00:30:16,316 --> 00:30:19,528
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:19,528 --> 00:30:21,822
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:22,573 --> 00:30:23,991
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:25,367 --> 00:30:26,827
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:26,827 --> 00:30:30,164
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:30,164 --> 00:30:34,877
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:35,252 --> 00:30:36,545
Let's see.

323
00:30:37,796 --> 00:30:40,465
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:46,221 --> 00:30:48,682
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:50,392 --> 00:30:53,520
And last but not least...

326
00:30:53,520 --> 00:30:56,023
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:58,942 --> 00:31:00,611
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:07,576 --> 00:31:11,246
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:11,246 --> 00:31:15,417
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:15,542 --> 00:31:16,752
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:16,752 --> 00:31:19,713
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:19,713 --> 00:31:21,590
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:21,590 --> 00:31:24,259
lsn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:24,259 --> 00:31:27,638
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:27,638 --> 00:31:30,557
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:30,557 --> 00:31:32,100
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:36,146 --> 00:31:38,148
lt requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:38,148 --> 00:31:39,816
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:39,816 --> 00:31:41,652
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:41,652 --> 00:31:43,654
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:43,654 --> 00:31:44,947
Absurd, l know.

342
00:31:44,947 --> 00:31:47,241
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:52,120 --> 00:31:53,288
lt is time.

344
00:32:39,251 --> 00:32:40,711
Shut it down.

345
00:32:59,271 --> 00:33:02,399
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:02,399 --> 00:33:04,276
lt's about time, dear.

347
00:33:54,952 --> 00:33:55,994
Hello?

348
00:34:04,211 --> 00:34:05,587
Wake up.

349
00:34:08,715 --> 00:34:10,175
Wake up!

350
00:34:20,269 --> 00:34:22,479
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:25,649 --> 00:34:28,402
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:08,353 --> 00:37:09,730
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:09,730 --> 00:37:11,815
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:11,815 --> 00:37:13,817
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:17,779 --> 00:37:19,948
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:50,062 --> 00:37:52,397
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:52,397 --> 00:37:54,566
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:54,566 --> 00:37:55,901
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:49,538 --> 00:38:51,498
Dr. Schreber, l presume.

360
00:38:51,498 --> 00:38:52,958
lt's you.

361
00:38:52,958 --> 00:38:54,084
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:54,084 --> 00:38:56,170
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:56,170 --> 00:38:58,463
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:58,463 --> 00:38:59,965
Please, l--

365
00:38:59,965 --> 00:39:01,842
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:39:01,842 --> 00:39:04,219
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:04,219 --> 00:39:06,180
l can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:06,180 --> 00:39:09,016
Nothing. l want to help you.

369
00:39:09,016 --> 00:39:12,436
We cannot talk here.
lf they see us together--

370
00:39:12,436 --> 00:39:15,355
l don't care.
l want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:15,355 --> 00:39:18,609
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:18,609 --> 00:39:19,651
Answer me!

373
00:39:24,740 --> 00:39:25,908
My God.

374
00:39:25,908 --> 00:39:28,911
-You really can do it.
-l did that?

375
00:39:28,911 --> 00:39:31,622
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:31,622 --> 00:39:33,624
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:33,624 --> 00:39:35,292
They call it ''Tuning.''

378
00:39:35,292 --> 00:39:37,294
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:37,294 --> 00:39:39,755
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:39,755 --> 00:39:42,591
but l can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:42,591 --> 00:39:46,762
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:49,890 --> 00:39:51,350
My glasses.

383
00:40:45,696 --> 00:40:48,073
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:48,073 --> 00:40:50,909
lollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:50,909 --> 00:40:53,829
So l told Fredrickson
l was letting him go.

386
00:40:53,829 --> 00:40:55,789
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:56,498 --> 00:41:00,169
He attacked me.
l don't know where he's gone.

388
00:41:00,169 --> 00:41:04,131
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:04,131 --> 00:41:06,717
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:09,136 --> 00:41:15,601
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:16,643 --> 00:41:24,651
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:27,613 --> 00:41:34,495
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:36,038 --> 00:41:41,877
l'll know, believe me, l'll know

394
00:41:43,337 --> 00:41:47,007
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:47,007 --> 00:41:51,053
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:51,053 --> 00:41:54,097
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:54,097 --> 00:41:55,766
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:55,766 --> 00:41:57,601
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:57,601 --> 00:42:01,188
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:42:01,188 --> 00:42:04,399
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:04,399 --> 00:42:08,570
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:08,654 --> 00:42:10,656
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:10,656 --> 00:42:14,117
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:14,993 --> 00:42:17,454
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:17,454 --> 00:42:21,500
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:23,043 --> 00:42:25,754
We must not do this.

407
00:42:25,754 --> 00:42:29,091
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:29,091 --> 00:42:32,010
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:32,010 --> 00:42:35,472
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:35,472 --> 00:42:36,723
will be known to us.

411
00:42:36,723 --> 00:42:41,937
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:41,937 --> 00:42:44,439
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:44,439 --> 00:42:47,151
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:47,151 --> 00:42:50,821
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:50,821 --> 00:42:52,364
lmprint.

416
00:42:57,828 --> 00:42:59,746
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:36,241 --> 00:43:37,951
ls it done?

418
00:43:37,951 --> 00:43:40,412
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:40,412 --> 00:43:44,291
l have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:44,917 --> 00:43:46,585
''Johnny...

421
00:43:46,585 --> 00:43:50,631
''Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:50,631 --> 00:43:52,841
''Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:52,841 --> 00:43:54,801
''Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:54,801 --> 00:43:58,055
''We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:58,055 --> 00:44:00,432
''Love to Emma. Karl.''

426
00:44:05,854 --> 00:44:06,897
Karl.

427
00:44:08,774 --> 00:44:10,359
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:18,617 --> 00:44:19,660
Harris.

429
00:44:27,876 --> 00:44:31,004
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:31,004 --> 00:44:32,256
Try the subway.

431
00:44:36,009 --> 00:44:37,553
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:37,553 --> 00:44:40,389
Been working here long?

433
00:44:40,389 --> 00:44:44,142
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:08,834 --> 00:45:11,879
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:46,079 --> 00:45:48,165
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:48,165 --> 00:45:50,042
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:50,042 --> 00:45:52,836
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:52,836 --> 00:45:55,464
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:55,464 --> 00:45:59,551
-This is irrational.
-lnstincts are irrational.

440
00:45:59,551 --> 00:46:02,846
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:02,846 --> 00:46:06,099
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:06,099 --> 00:46:07,476
His job.

443
00:46:07,476 --> 00:46:09,561
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:09,561 --> 00:46:12,481
lndulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:12,481 --> 00:46:15,150
lf you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:15,150 --> 00:46:18,529
lf l were Murdoch...

447
00:46:20,280 --> 00:46:23,826
l would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:23,826 --> 00:46:25,828
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:27,371 --> 00:46:28,956
And then...

450
00:46:30,833 --> 00:46:34,711
l would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:37,256 --> 00:46:42,177
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:45,514 --> 00:46:47,599
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:50,310 --> 00:46:51,478
All change?

454
00:46:51,478 --> 00:46:53,730
Excuse me, how do l get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:53,730 --> 00:46:55,232
You want the Express.

456
00:47:07,828 --> 00:47:10,372
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:10,372 --> 00:47:11,582
That's the Express.

458
00:47:13,250 --> 00:47:15,127
There's no way out.

459
00:47:15,127 --> 00:47:18,338
You can't get out of the city.
l've tried.

460
00:47:19,089 --> 00:47:21,175
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:21,175 --> 00:47:22,968
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:22,968 --> 00:47:24,094
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:24,094 --> 00:47:26,805
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:26,805 --> 00:47:28,473
like everyone else here.

465
00:47:28,473 --> 00:47:30,434
-Who are you?
-l was a cop.

466
00:47:30,434 --> 00:47:33,562
At least in this life l was.

467
00:47:33,562 --> 00:47:36,482
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:36,482 --> 00:47:38,358
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:38,358 --> 00:47:41,111
l seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:41,111 --> 00:47:43,280
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:43,280 --> 00:47:44,615
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:44,615 --> 00:47:46,408
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:46,408 --> 00:47:47,868
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:48,785 --> 00:47:51,330
lt's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:51,330 --> 00:47:52,581
lt happened to me.

476
00:47:53,290 --> 00:47:55,292
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:56,418 --> 00:47:58,712
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:58,712 --> 00:48:00,172
But that's OK.

479
00:48:00,172 --> 00:48:01,423
l figured a way out.

480
00:48:12,809 --> 00:48:14,019
They were here.

481
00:48:16,104 --> 00:48:17,606
Last night.

482
00:48:17,606 --> 00:48:19,900
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:22,486 --> 00:48:24,363
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:24,363 --> 00:48:26,782
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:26,782 --> 00:48:28,700
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:28,700 --> 00:48:30,828
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:35,415 --> 00:48:37,501
And l know where to find her.

488
00:48:45,926 --> 00:48:49,304
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:49,304 --> 00:48:50,347
l'm sorry?

490
00:48:50,347 --> 00:48:52,432
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:52,432 --> 00:48:54,393
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:55,185 --> 00:48:57,813
l thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:57,813 --> 00:48:59,606
Perhaps.

494
00:48:59,606 --> 00:49:02,109
There used to be a ferry
when l was a boy.

495
00:49:02,109 --> 00:49:04,194
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:04,194 --> 00:49:06,989
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:08,490 --> 00:49:11,076
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:11,076 --> 00:49:12,661
On this very spot.

499
00:49:14,079 --> 00:49:16,165
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:16,165 --> 00:49:20,169
l wish l knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:20,169 --> 00:49:22,963
l met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:22,963 --> 00:49:25,257
lt's where l met my husband.

503
00:49:25,257 --> 00:49:26,842
Small world.

504
00:50:20,938 --> 00:50:21,897
Hello?

505
00:51:09,319 --> 00:51:11,196
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:11,196 --> 00:51:12,781
l've been following you.

507
00:51:16,702 --> 00:51:18,370
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:20,455 --> 00:51:21,498
Johnny?

509
00:51:24,626 --> 00:51:26,003
lt's been so damn long,

510
00:51:26,003 --> 00:51:28,505
l thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:29,339 --> 00:51:30,674
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:34,136 --> 00:51:35,304
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:38,432 --> 00:51:39,474
Wait.

514
00:51:42,269 --> 00:51:44,480
-ls that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:52,696 --> 00:51:54,573
Shell Beach is where
l grew up?

516
00:51:54,573 --> 00:51:57,159
That's what l said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:57,159 --> 00:51:59,703
-Your home town.
-l need to get there.

518
00:51:59,703 --> 00:52:00,746
How do l get there?

519
00:52:02,164 --> 00:52:05,125
l don't know.
l haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:05,125 --> 00:52:08,337
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:09,922 --> 00:52:11,173
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:12,591 --> 00:52:15,511
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:18,972 --> 00:52:22,809
-lt was so bright there.
-Brighter times, l guess.

524
00:52:24,186 --> 00:52:27,523
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:27,523 --> 00:52:29,525
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:29,525 --> 00:52:31,902
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:31,902 --> 00:52:33,362
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:35,948 --> 00:52:37,115
Where are they now?

529
00:52:38,367 --> 00:52:40,118
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:40,118 --> 00:52:42,955
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:42,955 --> 00:52:44,540
l looked after you.

532
00:52:45,457 --> 00:52:47,209
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:50,045 --> 00:52:52,548
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:58,387 --> 00:53:00,347
lt's a scar.

535
00:53:00,347 --> 00:53:03,100
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:08,272 --> 00:53:09,857
What does it mean?

537
00:53:09,857 --> 00:53:11,859
lt means these are all lies!

538
00:53:15,863 --> 00:53:18,323
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:18,323 --> 00:53:21,118
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:21,118 --> 00:53:23,412
See if he was...

541
00:53:23,412 --> 00:53:25,789
capable of...

542
00:53:34,673 --> 00:53:36,550
l wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:36,550 --> 00:53:38,552
l thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:40,179 --> 00:53:42,181
l'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:58,447 --> 00:53:59,573
lt's beautiful.

546
00:54:02,284 --> 00:54:05,120
lt was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:05,120 --> 00:54:06,663
She died recently.

548
00:54:08,165 --> 00:54:10,334
l keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:12,503 --> 00:54:13,545
l'm sorry.

550
00:54:17,216 --> 00:54:19,426
lt's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:19,426 --> 00:54:22,221
l can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:24,306 --> 00:54:27,226
How do you think l could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:28,268 --> 00:54:30,771
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:30,771 --> 00:54:32,564
l'm not sure l know anymore.

555
00:54:36,527 --> 00:54:38,278
l left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:39,321 --> 00:54:41,615
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:41,615 --> 00:54:43,826
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:43,826 --> 00:54:46,537
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:47,663 --> 00:54:50,374
-ls that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:50,374 --> 00:54:52,876
That clock's kept perfect time
since l bought it.

561
00:54:52,876 --> 00:54:54,127
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:55,921 --> 00:54:58,298
-What do you think?
-l don't understand.

563
00:54:58,298 --> 00:55:01,134
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:55:01,134 --> 00:55:03,595
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:05,305 --> 00:55:06,348
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:06,348 --> 00:55:08,725
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:40,966 --> 00:55:42,092
Come on...

568
00:56:02,529 --> 00:56:05,532
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:05,532 --> 00:56:07,951
l know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:07,951 --> 00:56:10,162
Keep him there,
and l'll be right over.

571
00:56:10,162 --> 00:56:12,331
-l'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:15,876 --> 00:56:19,630
l can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:20,047 --> 00:56:22,841
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:29,556 --> 00:56:33,268
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:33,268 --> 00:56:37,147
lf you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:38,190 --> 00:56:40,692
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:55,267 --> 00:58:00,272
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:04,735 --> 00:58:07,237
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:07,237 --> 00:58:10,782
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:10,782 --> 00:58:12,242
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:12,242 --> 00:58:15,370
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:15,370 --> 00:58:19,124
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:19,124 --> 00:58:23,170
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:23,170 --> 00:58:26,298
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:26,298 --> 00:58:30,469
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:30,719 --> 00:58:34,139
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:34,973 --> 00:58:37,142
l understand you now.

588
00:58:37,142 --> 00:58:40,813
l remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:40,813 --> 00:58:46,443
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:46,443 --> 00:58:51,365
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:51,865 --> 00:58:55,118
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:55,118 --> 00:58:57,579
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:07,292 --> 01:01:08,335
Get in!

594
01:01:23,809 --> 01:01:27,771
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when l left her.

595
01:01:27,771 --> 01:01:30,899
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:30,899 --> 01:01:33,068
lt must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:33,068 --> 01:01:34,111
What pictures?

598
01:01:35,571 --> 01:01:38,490
-l don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:38,490 --> 01:01:40,993
-Stop telling me lies.
-l am not telling lies!

600
01:01:40,993 --> 01:01:43,412
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:43,412 --> 01:01:48,417
l have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:48,417 --> 01:01:51,712
You think it makes sense to me?
l'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:51,712 --> 01:01:55,716
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:55,716 --> 01:01:57,885
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:57,885 --> 01:01:59,553
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:02:00,179 --> 01:02:05,434
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:05,434 --> 01:02:07,060
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:09,021 --> 01:02:10,606
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:12,065 --> 01:02:14,443
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:15,736 --> 01:02:17,905
Wait. l got a better one.

611
01:02:17,905 --> 01:02:22,075
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:22,201 --> 01:02:25,621
-What do you mean?
-l just mean during the day.

613
01:02:26,455 --> 01:02:29,166
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:29,166 --> 01:02:32,920
l'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:32,920 --> 01:02:36,048
l mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:36,673 --> 01:02:38,467
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:40,219 --> 01:02:41,970
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:41,970 --> 01:02:47,518
l don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:47,518 --> 01:02:52,314
'Cause l've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:52,314 --> 01:02:54,733
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:54,733 --> 01:02:58,237
But listen to me, Bumstead.
lt's not just me.

622
01:02:58,237 --> 01:03:01,281
lt's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:03:01,281 --> 01:03:03,158
Shut up.
l've heard enough.

624
01:03:03,158 --> 01:03:05,869
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:16,296 --> 01:03:19,007
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:26,390 --> 01:03:27,432
Explain this.

627
01:03:49,246 --> 01:03:50,706
l'm so sorry.

628
01:03:51,832 --> 01:03:54,877
l never meant to hurt you.
l don't know why l did.

629
01:03:54,877 --> 01:03:56,545
l wish l could take it back.

630
01:03:57,254 --> 01:03:59,673
You didn't do it.

631
01:03:59,673 --> 01:04:01,425
This affair of yours,

632
01:04:01,425 --> 01:04:04,469
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:04,469 --> 01:04:05,721
l don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:05,721 --> 01:04:09,558
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:09,558 --> 01:04:12,811
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:12,811 --> 01:04:19,067
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:19,067 --> 01:04:21,778
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:21,778 --> 01:04:25,032
and everything l'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:25,032 --> 01:04:27,493
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:28,452 --> 01:04:30,037
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:30,621 --> 01:04:33,540
l so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:34,917 --> 01:04:37,336
l remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:38,879 --> 01:04:41,798
-l remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:43,467 --> 01:04:48,138
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:54,728 --> 01:04:56,188
l love you, John.

646
01:04:59,650 --> 01:05:01,819
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:03,487 --> 01:05:04,947
No, you can't.

648
01:05:34,268 --> 01:05:36,728
lnspector? Sir?

649
01:05:38,188 --> 01:05:41,358
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:43,277 --> 01:05:44,695
l thought you should know.

651
01:05:47,364 --> 01:05:51,577
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:05:58,542 --> 01:06:00,502
l knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:15,976 --> 01:06:17,102
Shoelace.

654
01:06:30,240 --> 01:06:33,869
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:36,914 --> 01:06:38,582
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:42,336 --> 01:06:43,504
Evening.

657
01:06:56,391 --> 01:07:00,354
l wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:02,564 --> 01:07:05,484
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:05,484 --> 01:07:06,401
Sleep.

660
01:07:36,974 --> 01:07:38,642
l knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:38,642 --> 01:07:41,019
lsn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:42,396 --> 01:07:45,482
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:48,443 --> 01:07:50,320
l come here often.

664
01:07:50,320 --> 01:07:53,323
lt's one of the few places
l'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:53,323 --> 01:07:56,785
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:57,411 --> 01:07:59,371
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:07:59,830 --> 01:08:02,499
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:02,499 --> 01:08:03,458
Right.

669
01:08:04,209 --> 01:08:09,006
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:09,006 --> 01:08:10,424
We all are.

671
01:08:12,134 --> 01:08:17,931
l'm sorry, but l have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:17,931 --> 01:08:22,019
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:22,019 --> 01:08:25,689
l need you to inject yourself.
lt's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:25,689 --> 01:08:28,484
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:28,484 --> 01:08:32,112
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:32,112 --> 01:08:34,448
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:34,448 --> 01:08:37,242
l may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:37,242 --> 01:08:40,245
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:40,245 --> 01:08:42,789
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:44,041 --> 01:08:48,003
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:49,630 --> 01:08:53,217
All the answers you've been
looking for, l swear to you.

682
01:08:54,718 --> 01:09:00,474
Guess l'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:09:00,474 --> 01:09:01,892
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:03,393 --> 01:09:06,522
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:06,980 --> 01:09:08,732
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:09,775 --> 01:09:13,737
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:22,162 --> 01:09:25,624
Won't find anything there.
l've been there--

688
01:09:25,624 --> 01:09:28,001
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:28,001 --> 01:09:31,672
l won't. l refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:31,672 --> 01:09:34,508
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:43,433 --> 01:09:48,230
l don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:53,277 --> 01:09:56,363
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:56,363 --> 01:09:58,157
Don't hurt me.
l'll tell you everything.

694
01:09:58,157 --> 01:09:59,950
lt doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:06,790 --> 01:10:07,833
What?

696
01:10:11,211 --> 01:10:12,754
Who are you people?

697
01:10:13,130 --> 01:10:15,966
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:17,342 --> 01:10:20,387
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:21,096 --> 01:10:23,390
-Anna.
-l'm not Anna.

700
01:10:25,058 --> 01:10:27,144
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:31,398 --> 01:10:34,234
l have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:43,744 --> 01:10:45,579
l call them Strangers.

703
01:10:46,246 --> 01:10:48,624
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:49,875 --> 01:10:54,046
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:54,254 --> 01:10:57,090
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:57,090 --> 01:10:59,676
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:11:00,219 --> 01:11:03,138
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:03,138 --> 01:11:05,808
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:06,266 --> 01:11:09,686
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:09,686 --> 01:11:14,149
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:14,149 --> 01:11:18,362
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:18,570 --> 01:11:20,447
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:20,447 --> 01:11:22,533
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:23,867 --> 01:11:28,455
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:28,455 --> 01:11:32,084
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:32,084 --> 01:11:37,297
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:37,297 --> 01:11:39,925
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:39,925 --> 01:11:41,385
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:41,385 --> 01:11:44,304
while l was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:44,304 --> 01:11:46,306
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:46,306 --> 01:11:50,435
lt is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:50,435 --> 01:11:52,354
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:52,354 --> 01:11:54,815
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:54,815 --> 01:11:57,651
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:57,651 --> 01:12:02,156
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:12:02,156 --> 01:12:07,035
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:07,035 --> 01:12:10,038
-They think we can save them.
-Where do l fit in?

728
01:12:10,038 --> 01:12:14,960
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:19,548 --> 01:12:22,968
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:22,968 --> 01:12:26,305
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:26,305 --> 01:12:29,224
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:29,224 --> 01:12:33,187
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:33,520 --> 01:12:36,231
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:36,231 --> 01:12:39,443
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:39,443 --> 01:12:40,944
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:40,944 --> 01:12:42,905
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:42,905 --> 01:12:47,075
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:47,284 --> 01:12:49,286
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:49,286 --> 01:12:51,747
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:51,747 --> 01:12:55,834
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:57,211 --> 01:13:02,216
l understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:13:02,216 --> 01:13:05,844
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:05,844 --> 01:13:07,304
because they needed them.

744
01:13:07,304 --> 01:13:09,723
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:18,232 --> 01:13:22,861
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:22,861 --> 01:13:26,490
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:27,032 --> 01:13:28,992
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:30,244 --> 01:13:34,414
What about this?
This was blank when l found it.

749
01:13:34,414 --> 01:13:38,293
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:38,293 --> 01:13:39,628
Not in this place.

751
01:13:39,628 --> 01:13:42,548
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:42,548 --> 01:13:44,424
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:44,424 --> 01:13:47,052
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:47,052 --> 01:13:48,512
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:50,889 --> 01:13:51,807
From where?

756
01:13:55,686 --> 01:13:58,814
l'm sorry. l don't remember.

757
01:13:59,731 --> 01:14:03,902
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:03,902 --> 01:14:07,865
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:25,299 --> 01:14:29,178
l've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:29,178 --> 01:14:30,095
Let's go.

761
01:15:15,599 --> 01:15:17,768
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:19,019 --> 01:15:21,188
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:22,856 --> 01:15:25,234
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:27,528 --> 01:15:29,112
is in your head.

765
01:15:40,582 --> 01:15:41,542
Stop!

766
01:15:54,680 --> 01:15:55,597
Please!

767
01:16:16,535 --> 01:16:18,620
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:18,180 --> 01:17:20,891
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:20,891 --> 01:17:23,310
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:23,310 --> 01:17:24,436
What do l care?

771
01:17:24,853 --> 01:17:27,064
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:27,064 --> 01:17:31,735
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:31,735 --> 01:17:36,323
l have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:37,991 --> 01:17:41,829
Shall l end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:45,082 --> 01:17:50,712
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:52,589 --> 01:17:53,549
Sleep.

777
01:17:55,717 --> 01:17:56,677
Now.

778
01:18:15,946 --> 01:18:16,905
Sleep.

779
01:18:26,081 --> 01:18:27,416
Kill him.

780
01:18:27,416 --> 01:18:28,458
Kill him !

781
01:18:38,969 --> 01:18:42,556
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:42,556 --> 01:18:45,851
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:45,851 --> 01:18:49,104
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:49,104 --> 01:18:53,066
lt is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:53,066 --> 01:18:55,903
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:55,903 --> 01:18:59,323
The time for study is over.

787
01:18:59,323 --> 01:19:03,494
lt is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:10,459 --> 01:19:13,795
lt is time, Doctor. lmprint.

789
01:19:16,423 --> 01:19:18,592
Shut it down!

790
01:19:19,551 --> 01:19:21,929
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:36,652 --> 01:19:37,694
What are you doing?

792
01:19:38,654 --> 01:19:43,742
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:44,493 --> 01:19:46,662
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:46,662 --> 01:19:48,872
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:48,872 --> 01:19:51,250
But l've got other plans.

796
01:19:54,586 --> 01:19:57,506
lmprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:57,506 --> 01:20:02,594
l'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:13,272 --> 01:20:14,898
Remember, John.

799
01:20:15,983 --> 01:20:18,068
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:18,068 --> 01:20:20,946
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:21,905 --> 01:20:22,823
Remember.

802
01:20:24,199 --> 01:20:27,119
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:27,119 --> 01:20:30,664
Now, remember what l told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:30,664 --> 01:20:32,207
John, remember.

805
01:20:32,207 --> 01:20:35,043
You're probably wondering why l
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:35,043 --> 01:20:37,546
lt's because l have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:37,546 --> 01:20:41,633
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:41,633 --> 01:20:45,053
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:47,514 --> 01:20:52,227
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:52,227 --> 01:20:53,812
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:54,438 --> 01:20:55,564
Remember.

812
01:20:56,315 --> 01:20:58,484
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:21:01,403 --> 01:21:06,241
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day l'll work for you.

814
01:21:06,241 --> 01:21:09,870
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:09,870 --> 01:21:11,622
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:11,622 --> 01:21:14,958
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:14,958 --> 01:21:19,963
l know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:21,548 --> 01:21:22,800
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:31,558 --> 01:21:33,560
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:33,560 --> 01:21:35,646
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:36,688 --> 01:21:37,731
What have you done?

822
01:21:38,774 --> 01:21:40,943
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:40,943 --> 01:21:42,945
but you must act now.

824
01:26:27,146 --> 01:26:31,316
l knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:31,525 --> 01:26:34,236
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:34,987 --> 01:26:39,449
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:39,449 --> 01:26:41,743
-So give her back her memories.
-l can't.

828
01:26:41,743 --> 01:26:46,248
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:46,665 --> 01:26:47,583
l'm sorry.

830
01:26:49,084 --> 01:26:51,086
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:54,047 --> 01:26:55,549
l'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:57,217 --> 01:27:00,846
You told me l had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:27:01,472 --> 01:27:04,808
l can make these machines
do anything l want.

834
01:27:05,434 --> 01:27:07,853
Make this world
anything l want it to be.

835
01:27:08,770 --> 01:27:12,941
Just so long as l concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:36,441 --> 01:28:37,609
Where are you going?

837
01:28:41,155 --> 01:28:42,114
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:23,489 --> 01:29:25,073
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:31,830 --> 01:29:33,499
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:34,833 --> 01:29:35,792
Thank you.

841
01:30:21,880 --> 01:30:23,757
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:24,466 --> 01:30:28,637
-What are you doing?
-l'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:28,846 --> 01:30:33,767
-We're sure that's what we want?
-l'll take my chances.

844
01:30:33,767 --> 01:30:39,606
l'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:39,606 --> 01:30:41,775
But l wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:43,569 --> 01:30:45,279
How you feel.

847
01:30:45,279 --> 01:30:47,948
You know how l was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:47,948 --> 01:30:52,119
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:52,119 --> 01:30:55,664
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:56,373 --> 01:31:00,586
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:31:01,837 --> 01:31:03,547
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:42,855 --> 01:32:44,648
lt's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:50,028 --> 01:32:51,280
So bright.

854
01:32:57,661 --> 01:33:00,080
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:33:00,455 --> 01:33:02,791
l think that's it over there.

856
01:33:21,018 --> 01:33:22,978
l'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:24,980 --> 01:33:26,356
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:29,568 --> 01:33:30,527
Sure.

859
01:33:35,908 --> 01:33:39,578
l'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?

860
01:33:39,578 --> 01:33:40,829
John.

861
01:33:42,706 --> 01:33:44,583
John Murdoch.
